There is a small Vermling in there who must have fallen in, and the pit is filled with snakes and scorpions. The Vermling seems frightened and softly whimpers as it looks up to you for help. You feel compelled to do something for the poor Vermling.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Help the Vermling out of the pit.

outcomes.narrative: You extend your hand down to the Vermling and quickly pull it up as scorpions snap toward it. Had you come a few minutes later, it would've been too late. The Vermling looks up to you gratefully with watery eyes before hurriedly scurrying away.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Throw the Vermling a few morsels for food.

outcomes.narrative: You grab a loaf of bread from your bag and throw it down into the pit. As the Vermling reaches toward it, the snakes in the pit hiss and extend their fangs. You watch in horror as the snakes indulge in their meal, leaving the bread untouched. You can't help but feel a tinge of remorse as you turn and slowly walk away.

narrative: After having accidentally stumbled into some thorn-bushes along the path, you find yourself with a deep cut that looks to be getting infected. You tend to the wound to the best of your ability and carry on with little time to lose. You begin to accept the fact that the cut will have to heal over time when you come across a Harrower dressed in red garb standing outside a medical tent. The Harrower chitters cheerfully as it introduces itself as a Vimthreader, and offers to tend to your wounds - for a small fee of five gold.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Pay the Vimthreader to tend to your cut.

outcomes.narrative: You pay the Vimthreader and it swiftly stitches up the laceration, chittering and hissing as it weaves each stitch. It thanks you for your payment and offers you a bizarre herbal concoction as a parting gift.
effects: During the scenario, one player gains the following benefit, then remove this card: During your turn, perform "Heal 3, Self".

options.label: B
options.narrative: Ask the Vimthreader to experiment on your wound for free.

outcomes.narrative: You ask the Vimthreader to experiment on your wound for free but it stands idle with no response. As you turn to leave, it grabs your arm and sits you down as it takes out a toolkit. The Harrower seems happy to have had the opportunity to stitch up the wound, but hastily ushers you out of the tent after finishing in anticipation for the next passerby.

narrative: The music gets louder as you near a large tent on the side of the road, marked with a multitude of Inox tribal signs. You hear drums banging and cheering from within while shadows of Inox figures dance around in a circle. It sounds like a celebration of dance and song, but something smells like it's burning and there is smoke pouring out from various holes in the tent.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Approach the tent and demand to know what's cooking.

outcomes.narrative: You approach the tent and are greeted by an Inox adorned in piercings and jewelry made of teeth. You ask her what's burning in the tent, and she hands you a bowl of hot soup, explaining that she's been preparing the meat all day. Exhausted from a long day's journey, you thank the Inox and hungrily shovel the chunky soup into your mouth; it has a peculiar yet palatable flavor. You hand the empty bowl back to her while once more expressing your gratitude. On your way back to the road, you watch a second Inox dumping out a large pot filled with congealed grease and what appears to be human bones. Your stomach grumbles unpleasantly, and you feel ill.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Request to join them in song and dance.

outcomes.narrative: You enter the tent and join hands with the Inox as you sing and dance around a fire. There is a pot bubbling in the center of the fire, and the Inox take turns pausing the dancing to throw in bones while chanting before erupting into more song and dance. You've had a great time but nightfall is approaching and it's time to carry on with your journey. The Inox give you gifts to depart with as you excuse yourself from the event.

narrative: Making your way across a narrow river leading over a waterfall, you see a large turtle stuck between two rocks. The rushing current is pulling stones and logs toward it and it's only a matter of time before an object knocks it over the waterfall. You feel that something should be done to rescue it, but the current is strong it's a long way down the waterfall.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Jump into the river to save the turtle.

outcomes.narrative: You leap into the river and grab the turtle. You quickly duck into the water as the current pulls a large log over your head, and you barely make it out before an entire tree is swept over the falls. You managed to save the large turtle just in the nick of time.
effects: At start of scenario, one character performs: Summon Snapping Turtle

options.label: B
options.narrative: Try to pull the turtle out with a stick.

outcomes.narrative: You reach for a long stick and use it to try lifting the turtle out of the rocks. You succeed, but the stick breaks and the turtle is sent flying over the waterfall.

narrative: You aim your bow and arrow at a bird in the sky and smile as your dinner falls to the ground. As you approach your meal, an Inox hops out of the bushes with a bow arched over its back. "Stay back, that bird is mine," the Inox snarls. At first you think the Inox must be joking, but he insists that this is his kill to claim.

options.label: A
options.narrative: It's not worth the fight. Stand down and find a different animal to hunt.

outcomes.narrative: You back away and let the Inox keep the bird. You spend the next few hours wandering around but the skies are empty, and eventually settle on a half-eaten bird carcass lying on the floor. You roast it and proceed to eat it, but the taste is foul and leaves you feeling sick.

options.label: B
options.narrative: You're not going anywhere. Prepare to fight to defend your dinner rights.

outcomes.condition: if inox or valrath in party
outcomes.narrative: You bang your chest and let out a battle cry. The Inox' eyes bulge and it backs away, agreeing to let you keep the bird. It makes for a tasty meal and you feel satisfied.
You draw your blade but the Inox is unimpressed. He lunges toward you and a brawl ensues, but you both pause at the sight of a fox running off with your meal.

narrative: You're walking through a mountainous area as snow begins to fall from the sky. As you traverse further closer to the mountaintop, you encounter deep snowbanks but continue trudging through when you take notice of a young Vermling huddled up beneath a tree. She's trembling and visibly shaken, and you inquire as to what's wrong.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Explain to the Vermling that it's harmless snow.

outcomes.narrative: You explain to the Vermling that it's harmless snow, and snowfall is natural this high up in the peaks. She thanks you for clearing up the confusion and offers to accompany you on your journey.
effects: Spawn one normal Vermling Scout next to any character. It is an ally to you and an enemy to all monsters.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Quietly accept the job and agree to escort the Vermling.

outcomes.narrative: You agree to escort the Vermling out of the mountains and lead her out of the snowy mountains. She thanks you, pays you and vows never to return to what she calls the 'cursed powder mountains' again.

narrative: You're climbing near a canyon when you hear a cry for help. You follow the voice to a rock formation and discover a Savvas with his leg stuck between two rocks. He cries out to you, explaining that he's been stuck for two days and you're the first one to cross his path. He lets out a large groan as he extends his hand out to you for help.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Help pull the Savvas out from the rock formation.

outcomes.narrative: With all your might, you manage to pull the Savvas out from the rock formation. He stumbles forward and clutches his throbbing leg, but he's smiling from ear to ear. "Please, take this mantle I've been wearing in return for your kindness," the Savvas says. "Don't worry about me, I'll make my way home."

options.label: B
options.narrative: Loot his bags and leave him for stranded.

outcomes.narrative: You ignore the Savvas groaning as you proceed to rummage through his bags. You find a peculiar pair of boots along with some rope and a blade. "Wait, please, don't abandon me!" the Savvas begs as you hand him the blade from the bag and leave him to figure out his own solution.

narrative: As you pass by a pile of Vermling corpses on the side of the road, you can't help but think there must be some kind of Vermling pandemic going around. You've seen several heaps of dead Vermling on this journey so far. All of a sudden, you feel sharp claws dig into your leg. You look down and see a furry arm sticking out from the pile of corpses, and its paw is tightly gripped around your ankle. The Vermling it belongs to trembles as it uses your leg to slowly pull itself out from the bottom of the pile. With all the strength it could muster, it slowly chokes out the words, "tree... of death... vermling... gardens..."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Ignore the message and dig through the pile of corpses for loot.

outcomes.narrative: You search through the corpses, hoping to find something of value but there is nothing worth scavenging besides rotten flesh.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Ask the Vermling for more information.

outcomes.narrative: You ask the Vermling to point you in the direction of the gardens. As it draws its final breath, the Vermling scratches coordinates into the dirt before collapsing to the ground.

narrative: Walking along a dirt path, you come across a small Aesther pinned down on the ground by a giant bear. The Aesther is whimpering with bear drool dripping down his cheek as the bear looks up to you and roars.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Attempt to rescue the Aesther by fighting the bear.

outcomes.narrative: "I am forever grateful," the Aesther bows toward you as he dusts himself off. "I am Nerro, the noble dream interpreter who practices in the Ward of Scales. Come see me if you ever need a dream interpreted."
effects: Add City Event 34 to the deck.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Distract the bear by throwing it food in the other direction.

outcomes.narrative: You throw food in the other direction, hoping to distract the bear. You remain hopeful as the bear stands up and sniffs the air, but your hopes are then crushed when the bear leans back over the Aesther and smacks its lips. You turn away as the bear opens its jaws wide and proceeds to indulge in its tasty meal.

narrative: You happen upon a large tent pitched on the side of the road, with a small wooden sign posted on the grass nearby that reads 'FORTUNE TELLER: 5 GOLD.' You enter the tent and find an Aesther wrapped in white robes sitting on a red velvet chair with a glass orb in her hands. She looks up to you with narrow eyes and asks in a soft voice, "have you come to hear your fortune?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Scoff at the Aesther, you don't believe in fortune telling.

outcomes.narrative: You scoff at the Aesther and state your disbelief in the practice of fortune telling. She narrows her eyes and begins waving her hands over the crystal ball. "Good fortune awaits!" she calls out as you proceed to exit her tent without payment.
effects: All players ignore negative scenario effects.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Pay the Aesther to hear your fortune told.

outcomes.narrative: You pay the Aesther her fee and she begins to wave her hands over the crystal ball while humming a quiet tune. "The battlefield lies ahead. The choices you make will dictate your fortune. Choose wisely and you shall surely prosper."
effects: All players may select 3 battle goals to choose from instead of 2.

narrative: You happen upon a large tent pitched on the side of the road, with a small wooden sign posted on the grass nearby that reads 'FORTUNE TELLER: 5 GOLD.' You enter the tent and find an Aesther wrapped in gold robes sitting on a blue velvet chair with a glass orb in her hands. She looks up to you with narrow eyes and asks in a soft voice, "have you come to hear your fortune?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Scoff at the Aesther, you don't believe in fortune telling.

outcomes.narrative: You scoff at the Aesther and state your disbelief in the practice of fortune telling. She narrows her eyes and begins waving her hands over the crystal ball. "Bad fortune awaits!" she calls out as you proceed to exit her tent without payment.
effects: All start scenario with CURSE x2.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Pay the Aesther to hear your fortune told.

outcomes.narrative: You pay the Aesther her fee and she begins to wave her hands over the crystal ball while humming a quiet tune. "Good fortune awaits! Your enemies will be crippled and you will have the upper hand in battle."
effects: Monsters start scenario with CURSE x2.

narrative: It's the middle of the night and you reach a fork in the road. On the left, you see a path leading into a dark forest. There are various bioluminescent bugs glowing beneath the trees. On the right, there is a straight dirt path laden with thorns.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Take the left path through the forest.

outcomes.narrative: You head into the forest and find that the bioluminescent bugs provide you with a clean, bright light that illuminates the path before you. You take advantage of the light and stride through the path, avoiding several large beehives on the way.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Take the right path through the thorns.

outcomes.narrative: You head into the thorn-laden path but find it difficult to navigate around the hazardous bushes in the dark. You end up reaching your destination with a few bleeding cuts after stumbling headfirst into a thorn-bush.

narrative: It's the middle of the day and you reach a fork in the road. On the left, you see a path leading into a dark forest. There are various insects buzzing beneath the trees. On the right, there is a straight dirt path laden with thorns.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Take the left path through the forest.

outcomes.narrative: You head into the forest but the density of the trees blocks the sunlight and you have trouble staying on the path. In the midst of the darkness you accidentally stumble into a large beehive and eventually make it out of the forest with a few burning stings to remember your journey by.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Take the right path through the thorns.

outcomes.narrative: As the sun shines down from above, you walk through the dirt path and are easily able to avoid the thornbushes in the daylight. You manage to make it through the path without a single scratch.

narrative: As you venture down the road, you take notice of a vile stench seeping out from a nearby ditch. You peer down and see a human corpse lying within. The corpses' bony hands are gripped around a long saber and an oddly-shaped shield. This would be the perfect opportunity to stock up on some extra gear for battle, but your bag is packed tight and space is limited.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Pry the saber out from the right hand.

outcomes.narrative: You pry the saber from the corpses hand and hold it tight. It's rusty and deteriorated but you could likely get a few good swings out of it.
effects: One player gains the following benefit during the scenario, then remove this card:
During your next two single-target melee attacks, add +1 Attack to the attack.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Grab the shield from the left hand.

outcomes.narrative: You slide the shield out from between the skeleton's bony fingers and clang your blade against it. It's in poor shape but likely to protect you from a few blows before it decays.
effects: One player gains the following benefit during the scenario, then remove this card:
On the next three sources of damage to you from attacks, gain Shield 1.

narrative: You come across a booth set up on the side of the road, where an Inox bearing articles of clothing resembling tribal gear sits aside a collection of totems in different shapes and sizes. "These spiritual totems are used by our tribes in battle," the Inox explains. "For the small price of ten gold, one of them could be yours." The Inox places two totems on the table of his booth. "Today, I can sell you the Drake Totem of Confusion or the Eagle Totem of Watchfulness. Which would you care to buy?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Offer to buy the drake totem.

outcomes.narrative: The drake totem!" the Inox smiles as he places a totem resembling a drake on the table. "Used throughout the ages as an emblem to confuse enemies. Excellent choice.
effects: During the scenario, place one totem obstacle next to any character. All characters adjacent to this obstacle add MUDDLE to all melee attacks.

outcomes.narrative: Not today, huh?" the Inox frowns. "May the animal spirits be with you.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Offer to buy the eagle totem.

outcomes.narrative: The eagle totem!" the Inox nods in agreement as he places a totem resembling an eagle on the table. "Sought after by many healers as a sign of watchfulness. Wise choice.
effects: During the scenario, place one totem obstacle next to any character. Whenever a character ends their turn adjacent to the totem, they may perform "Heal 1, Self".

outcomes.narrative: Maybe a different day then.

narrative: You come across a booth set up on the side of the road, where an Inox bearing articles of clothing resembling tribal gear sits aside a collection of totems in different shapes and sizes. "These spiritual totems are used by our tribes in battle," the Inox explains. "For the small price of ten gold, one of them could be yours." The Inox places two totems on the table of his booth. "Today, I can sell you the Bull Totem of Aggression or the Dog Totem of Protection. Which would you care to buy?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Offer to buy the bull totem.

outcomes.narrative: The bull totem!" the Inox smiles as he places a totem resembling a bull on the table. "Channels rage into tactical aggression. Powerful choice.
effects: During the scenario, place one totem obstacle next to any character. All characters adjacent to this obstacle gain Retaliate 1.

outcomes.narrative: Not today, huh?" the Inox frowns. "May the animal spirits be with you.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Offer to buy the dog totem.

outcomes.narrative: The dog totem!" the Inox nods in agreement as he places a totem resembling a dog on the table. "Represents the guard dogs used in battle to help protect their owners. Smart choice.
effects: During the scenario, place one totem obstacle next to any character. All characters adjacent to this obstacle gain Shield 1.

outcomes.narrative: Maybe a different day then.

narrative: You come across a booth set up on the side of the road, where an Inox bearing articles of clothing resembling tribal gear sits aside a collection of totems in different shapes and sizes. "These spiritual totems are used by our tribes in battle," the Inox explains. "For the small price of ten gold, one of them could be yours." The Inox places two totems on the table of his booth. "Today, I can sell you the Kangaroo Totem of Balance or the Camel Totem of Endurance. Which would you care to buy?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Offer to buy the kangaroo totem.

outcomes.narrative: The Inox smiles as he places a totem resembling a kangaroo on the table. "Used to instill a sense of balance within those who gaze at it. Brilliant choice."
effects: During the scenario, place one totem obstacle next to any character. All characters adjacent to this obstacle gain Advantage on all attacks.

outcomes.narrative: The Inox frowns. "May the animal spirits be with you."

options.label: B
options.narrative: Offer to buy the camel totem.

outcomes.narrative: The Inox nods in agreement as he places a totem resembling a camel on the table. "Thought to aid any to endure the harshest of conditions. Perfect choice."
effects: During the scenario, place one totem obstacle next to any character. All characters adjacent to this obstacle are immune to negative conditions.

outcomes.narrative: Maybe a different day then.

narrative: You come across a group of Brightsparks on the side of the road. Dressed in full lab gear, they beckon you toward them and offer you two vials to choose from. One of the vials is filled with a bubbling red liquid and the other with glowing green ooze.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Try the bubbling red liquid.

outcomes.narrative: You sip the bubbling red liquid, and it has an oddly sour berry flavor. Moments after you finish the last drop, you feel a surge of adrenaline run through your veins. You feel energized and your senses are heightened.
effects: At the start of the first round after all cards have been revealed, each player may decrease their leading initiative by 20.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Try the glowing green ooze.

outcomes.narrative: You quickly drink the glowing green ooze, and it has a sweet herbaceous taste. Moments after finishing the last drop, you begin to feel groggy and dreary. You turn away sluggishly and your senses feel repressed.
effects: At the start of the first round after all cards have been revealed, each player adds 20 to their leading initiative.

narrative: You come across a group of Brightsparks on the side of the road. Dressed in full lab gear, they beckon you toward them and offer you two vials to choose from. One of the vials is filled with a glowing red liquid and the other with bubbling green ooze. "We're running an experiment and would appreciate if you would test one of these out for us," the Brightspark grins. "Just let us know how it goes when you make your way back to the city."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Try the glowing red liquid.

outcomes.narrative: You guzzle the glowing red liquid, and it has a delicious berry taste. Moments after licking the last drop, your head begins to pulse and ache. You stumble away, feeling weary and confused.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Try the bubbling green ooze.

outcomes.narrative: You gulp down the bubbling green ooze, and it has a spicy, bitter aftertaste. Moments after finishing the last drop, you feel a rush of energy surge throughout your body. You turn away with your head held high, feeling invigorated and refreshed.

narrative: Walking amongst a cavernous area, you hear a voice calling from within one of the caves. You approach the sound of the voice and see a rope tied to a tree leading down into the deep cavern. "Please, help!" the voice calls from below. "I'm too tired to pull myself up, can you please help me by pulling up the rope?" You peer down into the cavern and see only darkness below. The climber must be far down, and it would take great effort to pull him up.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Assist the climber by pulling up the rope.

outcomes.narrative: You start to pull on the rope with all your might. After several minutes of pulling, a bearded man emerges from the cave. "You saved me!" the man exclaims. "Unfortunately I do not have anything of value with me to repay you with, as my expedition proved to be fruitless. However, I'm sure karma will take care of you." The man smiles as he pats your shoulder before he gathers his belongings and begins to walk away, leaving you short of breath.
effects: Add City Event 33 to the deck.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Cut the rope and steal the bag he left by the tree.

outcomes.narrative: You begin to cut the rope and hear the voice cry out from below, 'wait! What are you doing! Please, no! No!' The climber continues pleading as you furiously begin to cut faster. You hear the rope snap, followed by a fading scream and then - silence. You pick up his bags with hopes to sell the valuables within during your next trip to town, but the bag turns out to be filled with nothing but snacks and some old rope.

narrative: While wandering the road at night, you suddenly see a flash of bright light, followed by a loud shattering noise originating from a cave entrance nearby. Near it, an abandoned merchant cart is parked. As you head inside the cave, the sound of sword slashes, breaking glass and the occasional flash of light guides you deeper, when suddenly you see a merchant and his guard fighting an Orchid. On the ground near the Orchid, a sack filled with glowing red crystals that could be of either party. As you inspect the Orchid, which has a crystal skin far larger than you have ever seen, he breaks of a piece of his crystal skin which he threatens to throw at you. At that same time, the merchant manages to grab the sack and attempts to flee.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Engage the Orchid.

outcomes.narrative: A fellow orchid stops your engage and shouts, "That is a member of the order of Shardrenders, do not intervene!". You watch as the Shardrender pierces the merchant's heart with a crystal and runs off with the sack.
As your sword slashes into the crystal skin of the orchid, a big shock wave of shards emits, injuring and knocking everyone prone, leaving the orchid to flee with the sack.
effects: All start scenario with MUDDLE and WOUND.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Stop the merchant in his attempt to flee with the crystals.

outcomes.narrative: You help the orchid fend off the attackers. "You made the right decision, these were bandit thieves" the Orchid explains with an expression of gratitude. "These special crystals are of vital importance for my order, the order of Shardrenders, and your deed will not be forgotten." He hands you a small purse of gold before taking his leave.

narrative: You're carefully walking along a forest path when you see a set of traps up ahead. They appear to have been marked for animals, but wildlife in these parts are scarce and someone could easily break their foot by accidentally stepping in one of the traps.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Attempt to dismantle the traps.

outcomes.narrative: You begin to dismantle each trap, carefully closing them while being mindful of your grip. As the last trap shuts closed, you realize one of these could be useful in your journey forward.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Avoid the traps and proceed to walk through the path.

outcomes.narrative: You tiptoe your way around the traps when you hear a loud 'SNAP!' and feel a sharp pain run up your leg. You've accidentally stepped into one of the traps, and it's going to be painful to remove.

narrative: Traveling across swamplands, you see various animals sprinting out from the marsh in different directions. You hear a shrill screeching coming from the distance, and it sounds like it's coming from deep within the swamp.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Continue heading into the swamp and investigate the screeching noise.

outcomes.narrative: You head straight into the swamp as the screeching grows louder. You peer through tall reeds and see a hideous giant purple creature with swarming tentacles grab a viper and swallow it whole. This creature does not look like it belongs here.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Turn around and take the long route to circumvent the swamp.

outcomes.narrative: Deciding to take the longer route, you turn around and continue on your journey. The screeching begins to fade as you distance yourself from the swamp. You eventually reach your destination, your boots worn out but virtually unharmed.

narrative: As you depart the city, you find a snake charmer sitting outside the gates with a pungi in hand. There is a basket filled with vipers by his feet and he's playing a soft tune. The vipers seem to be entranced by the music as they slowly wave their bodies in perfect synch. The charmer abruptly stops playing and looks up to you as he says, "I'm in need of a new pungi, could you please spare a few coin?" Before you can answer, he narrows his eyes and points to the basket filled with snakes. "My snakes would be quite unhappy if you don't."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Help the charmer with a small donation.

outcomes.narrative: You hand the charmer a few coins and proceed to continue on with your journey. "Wait!" the charmer calls after you. "Here, have one of my vipers as a thank-you gift. Take good care of him for me, will you?"
effects: At start of scenario, one character performs: Summon Slithering Viper

options.label: B
options.narrative: Refuse to give the charmer any of your hard-earned gold.

outcomes.narrative: You refuse to give the charmer any of your gold and turn away to continue with your journey. You feel a sharp sting running up your ankle and turn around to see one of the vipers slithering away. The charmer smiles devilishly as he continues playing his pungi.

narrative: You're passing by a caravan when you hear a muffled scream from within. You peer in out of curiosity and see an Orchid tied up to a chair in an otherwise empty caravan.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Untie the ropes and free the captive Orchid.

outcomes.narrative: You begin to untie the ropes from around the Orchid. The Orchid stands up, revealing shining silhouette armor. All of a sudden, the Orchid's hands begin to glow and a devious smile grows across her face. Before you can react, she blasts you out of the caravan with a powerful spell and dashes out into the road. As you dust off your clothes, you reach into your pockets and realize you've been pickpocketed.
effects: Add Road Event 33 to the deck.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Wait outside for the captors to return. There must be a good reason for this.

outcomes.narrative: After patiently waiting for about an hour, several large Inox wearing heavy armor wrapped in chains approach the caravan. You question the circumstances and the Inox explain that they're bounty hunters, and this Orchid is a dangerous wanted criminal. They thank you with a gift for guarding the caravan and begin to prepare for the next leg of their journey.

narrative: You come across a booth set up on the side of the road, where a Vermling bearing articles of clothing resembling tribal gear sits aside a collection of totems in different shapes and sizes. "These spiritual totems are used by our tribes in battle," the Vermling explains. "For the small price of ten gold, one of them could be yours." The Inox places two totems on the table of his booth. "Today, I can sell you the Kangaroo Totem of Confusion. Would you care to buy one?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Offer to buy the kangaroo totem.

outcomes.narrative: You agree to buy the kangaroo totem. "Excellent!" the Vermling rubs his hands together and hands you the totem. The totem looks different than others you've seen, with strange markings and a deformed head. You carry on with your journey while inspecting it, and by the time you realize it's a fake, the Vermling has already packed its bags and scurried off.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Decline the offer.

outcomes.narrative: You tell the Vermling you won't be buying a totem today. "Not today? Not today?!" the Vermling yells as he jumps onto the table, knocking over several totems onto the floor. He begins to jump in madness and flail his arms in the air while shouting, "Not today! Not today!" He grabs an armful of totems and dashes off into the distance, leaving behind his booth and a small tin filled with gold.

narrative: You happen across a Quatryl stranded on the side of the road as if waiting to hitch a ride. "Hey, I recognize you!" the Quatryl peps up. "It's me, Shiela!" "I've gotten kind of lost after last night's drinking. If you're heading toward the Mixed District, do you mind letting me tag along?" You weren't planning on heading in that direction, but Shiela's a good friend.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Go out of your way and escort Shiela to the Mixed District.

outcomes.narrative: You escort Shiela backed to the Mixed District, and she thanks you profusely before heading into her apartment. It was an uneventful journey, but you find yourself far behind schedule as this was much out of your way.
effects: All players spend one BOOT item.
Add City Event 32 to the deck.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Tell Shiela she'll have to find another ride and continue on your journey.

outcomes.narrative: "Please!" Shiela begs as you adamantly refuse to go out of your way. She bursts into tears as you walk away, shouting after you, "the other patrons in the Sleeping Lion will surely hear about this!".

narrative: Snow continues to fall fast as you wade through the sleet. This blizzard is unlike anything you've ever experienced, and as you traverse through the barren area you contemplate finding a place to rest through the unexpected storm. You take notice of an isolated cave with a glowing blue light emanating from within, and as you enter the cave you find an Orchid meditating with her eyes closed. You recognize the Orchid as a Frostborn; you've heard tales how seeing a Frostborn could be a bad omen, but she seems deep in thought and doesn't take notice of you.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Take respite in the cave.

outcomes.narrative: You spend the night in the cave, taking care not to make any noise so as not to disturb the meditating Frostborn. As you prepare to leave, you feel a cold hand on your shoulder. You turn to see the Frostborn, who offers to teach you one of her powerful spells to help you on your journey.
effects: All monsters start scenario with IMMOBILIZE.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Continue on and brave the storm.

outcomes.narrative: You depart from the cave and continue on throughout the snowstorm. You eventually make it to your destination, but your hands are numb from the cold and you can no longer feel your feet.

narrative: Your stomach grumbles loudly as you climb your way through a mountainous area. Wildlife in this area is scarce and rations are low. You happen upon a pack of Vermlings nestled in some bushes on the side of a cliff. They're sleeping next to a bag filled with food, and you decide to sneak some from their bag. As you approach the bag of food, a light from behind shines in your direction. You turn around to find a Vermling, wide-awake and holding a portable tech lamp. He asks you what you're doing here and you have to react quickly.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Explain you're here for the food and aren't leaving without it.

outcomes.narrative: You explain you're not leaving without food and the Vermling insists he won't share. As you continue to argue with the Vermling, he shines the light toward your face and stares for a few seconds, before smiling cheerfully and claiming to recognize you. He mentions something about you helping him unscrew a lightbulb from a tech lamp and sends you away feeling invigorated with a full stomach.
effects: During the first round of the scenario, before any cards are revealed, any characters may declare to act on Initiative 01 instead of their leading initiative.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Tell the Vermling you lost your way.

outcomes.narrative: You tell the Vermling you lost your way and he warns you to leave. You continue on with your journey but have no luck finding more food. You manage to make it to your destination but feel sluggish and worn out from the lack of sustenance.
effects: During the first round of the scenario, all characters act on Initiative 99 instead of their leading initiative.

narrative: Your stomach grumbles loudly as you climb your way through a mountainous area. Wildlife in this area is scarce and rations are low. You happen upon a pack of Vermlings nestled in some bushes on the side of a cliff. They're sleeping next to a bag filled with food, and you decide to sneak some from their bag. As you approach the bag of food, a light from behind shines in your direction. You turn around to find a Vermling, wide-awake and holding a portable tech lamp. He asks you what you're doing here and you have to react quickly.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Explain you're here for the food and aren't leaving without it.

outcomes.narrative: You explain you're not leaving without food and the Vermling insists he won't share. You grab the bag and begin to run in the opposite direction, and the Vermling gives chase. You eventually outrun the Vermling and enjoy a hearty meal, but as you reach your destination you turn around and find the Vermling has caught up and is angrily charging toward you.
effects: Spawn one elite Vermling Scout next to any character. It is an enemy to all figures.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Tell the Vermling you lost your way.

outcomes.narrative: You tell the Vermling you lost your way and he warns you to leave. You continue on with your journey but have no luck finding more food. You manage to make it to your destination but feel sluggish and worn out from the lack of sustenance.
effects: During the first round of the scenario, all characters act on Initiative 99 instead of their leading initiative.

narrative: Walking alongside a brook, you take notice of a female Orchid meditating by the water. As you peer closer, you can't help but notice her shiny armor looks strikingly familiar. You've untied and been mugged by a similar looking Orchid not too long ago, and have since seen 'wanted' posters with her mugshot posted around town. You're not prepared to let her get away a second time.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Verbally demand the Orchid repay you what she stole.

outcomes.narrative: You approach the Orchid and catch her by surprise. Startled, her hands begin to glow but you explain that you're not interested in a fight and only want to reclaim what's been stolen. She proceeds to explain that she spent all the gold, but she can give you the armor she's wearing if you promise not to report her to the authorities.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Use physical force to subdue her.

outcomes.narrative: You sneak up to the Orchid and press your blade against her throat from behind. Not wanting to be harmed, she allows you to tie her arms together with rope. She claims to have spent all the gold, so you proceed to return her to town to collect her bounty instead.

narrative: Walking through a mountainous area not too far from the city, you double-take as you realize what you first thought to be a sleeping bear on the side of the road is a gargantuan Vermling. You recognize the creature from the time you investigated the sewers in search of a giant Vermling and vow not to let it get away from you a second time. It snores loudly and turns over as you slowly approach it from behind. It's deep in slumber and you must decide how to proceed.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Set a bear trap near the Vermling and wait.

outcomes.narrative: You set up a bear trap near the Vermling and eagerly wait for it to awaken. After what seems like hours, the Vermling finally stands up and you hear a loud snap. You pop out of the bushes, only to find both the Vermling and the trap have disappeared. You groan upon realizing that it'll take more than a bear trap to subdue this beast, and hope to encounter it again in the future.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Ambush it with an attack while it sleeps.

outcomes.narrative: You sneak up towards the Vermling and swing at it with your blade. Having been awoken from the gash, the Vermling jolts awake and lunges toward you, claws extended, and slashes you across the face before running off into the mountains. You wipe the blood from the wound and recognize that you could have prepared yourself better for the fight.

narrative: You come across a group of men huddled together on the side of the road. They seem intensely focused on something as they mutter under their breath while exchanging colorful concoctions and pour various smoking liquids into a pot. "Come, travelers! Come see this marvelous experiment!" one of the men gleefully exclaims as he motions you forward. "You seem like a strong, capable group. We could use some help stirring and mixing the heavy brew." You glance over and see a bubbling cauldron with sparks flying all over.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Help the men mix the brew.

outcomes.narrative: You begin to slowly mix the brew as the men shout in excitement and continue pouring in various liquids. All of a sudden, the pot explodes and the liquid erupts with the force of a volcano. You try and step away as fast as you can, but your clothing becomes singed and your skin is scathed. The men begin apologizing and mention something about disproportionation measurements. These men clearly did not know what they were doing.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Decline and continue forward.

outcomes.narrative: You politely decline and carry forward with your journey. Several minutes after departing from the scene, you hear a large explosion and see a cloud of smoke rising in the distance. It's a good thing you didn't stick around.

narrative:
You come across a group of men huddled together on the side of the road. They seem intensely focused on something as they mutter under their breath while exchanging colorful concoctions and pour various smoking liquids into a pot. You vaguely recognize one of the men as a Brightspark but he's too busy concentrating on his work to notice you.

"Come, travelers! Come see this marvelous experiment!" one of the men gleefully exclaims as he motions you forward. "You seem like a strong, capable group. We could use some help stirring and mixing the heavy brew."

You glance over and see a bubbling cauldron with sparks flying all over.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Help the men mix the brew.

outcomes.narrative: As you approach the group of men, you recognize one particular Brightspark from your previous adventures. This warm sense of familiarity provides you with a sense of trust as you proceed to help the men mix their concoction. After several minutes of tiresome mixing, the brew turns a bright orange color. "We've done it!" the Brightspark jumps for joy as he grabs ahold of your shoulders and shakes them with joy. "Here, have some! It will surely help you."
effects: All start scenario with BLESS x2.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Decline and continue forward.

outcomes.narrative: The men among the group angrily scold you for not wanting to help. Although you declined in a polite manner, the men begin unclipping vials of liquid from their belts and start throwing them in your direction. You flee the scene, but not before enduring a few bruises and burns from the pelting.

narrative: A faint groaning sound coming from ahead catches your attention. As you approach closer, you take notice of an injured bear on the side of the road. You cautiously approach the animal with one hand on your blade in case it decides to attack. Further inspection reveals that the bear is in poor condition. Its feet appear to be twisted and its body severely wounded. There are birds of prey circling above. If left alone, the bear won't survive the night.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Tend to its wounds.

outcomes.narrative: You take the time to nurse the bear back to health. Confident that you've given it a fighting chance for survival, you begin to leave, only to notice the bear following you. It's limping, but you sense gratitude and it doesn't seem to want to leave your side.
effects: Spawn one normal Cave Bear next to any character. It is an ally to you and an enemy to all monsters. It has a maximum hit point value of 5, regardless of the value listed on its stat sheet.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Don't poke the bear, it's too risky.

outcomes.narrative: You ignore the bears pleading for help and carry on with your journey. You feel a slight sense of remorse as wonder what could have been had you helped the bear, but there's no looking back now.

narrative: As nightfall approaches, you seek a place to set up camp for the night when you come across an abandoned campsite. As you peek into the tent, you find a small group of Vermlings staring back at you. They seem to have settled in and don't look interested in leaving.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Fight the Vermlings off. You deserve a place of rest more than they do.

outcomes.narrative: You draw your weapon, ready to fight the Vermlings off. They immediately scatter at the sight of your blade, leaving behind a small backpack filled with supplies. Within the backpack you find a crossbow and a single bolt. This will come in handy in the battlefield. One player may take this card. During that player's turn, they may play this card as a top action instead of one of their ability cards to perform "Attack 4, Range 3" at the leading initiative of the other card played. This card can be discarded and is immediately removed upon being played. This card cannot be lost to avoid suffering damage.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Leave and continue searching for a place to rest. It's not worth the fight.

outcomes.narrative: Not wanting to pick a fight, you depart from the tent. A few minutes later you happen across an empty caravan. There are no Vermlings, but you do find a few random items that might fetch you a few coins at the market.

narrative: As you walk down the road you hear loud clanging coming from ahead. As you near the noise, you find a tent set up on the side of the road. An elderly man exits the tent and greets you, claiming to be a blacksmith who forges weapons for the military and asks to examine yours. "My, this could use an upgrade," the blacksmith narrows his eyes as he slides his finger across the handle of your weapon. "I'll tell you what. Surrender this weapon to me, and I'll pay you handsomely for it." "Alternatively, for the low price of ten gold, I could forge you a blade so jagged it could penetrate the strongest armors. Military grade."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Offer to sell your weapon to the blacksmith.

outcomes.narrative: You offer to sell your weapon to the blacksmith, and he smiles before asking you to wait while he grabs his pouch of coin. You make the exchange and carry on with your journey.
effects: One player loses one ITEM or HIDE and gains 30 GOLD.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Request the blacksmith forge you a new blade.

outcomes.narrative: You ask the blacksmith to forge you a new weapon and he asks you to wait several minutes outside the shop. You hear his banging of the anvil as smoke pour out of the shop, and minutes later he exits and dusts the soot off his jacket as he hands you a newly forged blade.
effects: One player loses 10 GOLD and gains one "Jagged Sword" (Item 25).

narrative: "Halt, stranger!" a Quatryl encased in a device surrounded by cannons extends his arm out and shakes his head. "You're approaching official military territory. I'm afraid you can't pass through here. You'll have to turn around and head through the forest instead." Going around through the forest could add days to your trips. There's no choice but to pass through.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Attempt to persuade the Quatryl with the hope that he's in a reasonable mood.

outcomes.narrative: You explain to the Quatryl who you are, and as he listens he decides to introduce you to his commander. You recognize the Bombard, exchange smiles and he gives you full permission to pass through.
You explain to the Quatryl who you are, but he doesn't seem to be impressed. Several more Quatryls appear and forcefully escort you off the grounds.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Offer to bribe the Quatryl in exchange for letting you pass.

outcomes.narrative: The Quatryl looks around to ensure there are no witnesses and hastily ushers you through to the other side.
The Quatryl shakes his head. "This is no trivial matter. I should have you jailed for this." The Quatryl motions for backup, and you hastily scurry off before things get out of hand.

narrative: You happen upon an old beggar on the side of the road. His clothes are tattered and torn, his long white beard is scraggly and he flashes you a smile full of rotting, cracked teeth. "Traveler, care to spare a little food?" he croaks in a hoarse voice. You brought extra rations and hand him a small loaf of bread. The beggar grabs hold of the bread and closes his eyes as he breathes deeply, soaking in its aroma. "Now I bless you in return!" he exclaims. "Care to be blessed with longevity or sustenance?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Ask to be blessed with longevity.

outcomes.narrative: You asked to be blessed with longevity. The old man puts his hands over your head and mumbles, leaving a smear of dirt and your forehead. He kisses your cheek and then sits down and begins picking at the bread and licking the crumbs from his hand.
effects: At the end of the first round, each character may Recover one discarded card.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Ask to be blessed with sustenance.

outcomes.narrative: You asked to be blessed with sustenance. The man waves his hands over your head, dropping small bits of dirt in your eyes as he mumbles. He kisses your forehead and then sits down and waves you off.
effects: At start of scenario, place one money token in an unoccupied hex adjacent to each character.

narrative: As you make your way down a cobblestone road, you find a man with a long white flowing beard kneeling down on the side of the road, mumbling to himself. As you pass him by, he looks up to you and clears his throat. "Travelers, I am praying on behalf of all who merit to cross my path. Tell me, are you on the path of righteousness or on the path of despair?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Respond with "path of righteousness".

outcomes.narrative: You answer that you are on the path of righteousness and the man smiles warmly. "Very well then. I shall pray for you to continue to walk the path of prosperity and good merit!"
effects: Start scenario with SUN in the Strong column.
During the first round, consider any negative attack modifier drawn by players to be a +0 instead.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Respond with "path of despair".

outcomes.narrative: You answer that you are on the path of despair and the man instantly frowns. "Well, if that's the path you choose, I shall pray for you to continue to walk the path of anguish and dishearten your enemies!"
effects: Start scenario with MOON in the Strong column.
During the first round, consider any negative attack modifier drawn by players to be a -1 instead.

narrative: You happen upon a sleeping hooded figure tucked upon a pile of straw on the side of the road. As you peer closer, you begin to take notice that the face looks vaguely familiar. You've seen 'wanted' posters around town with a similar-looking face. Perhaps this is a wanted bandit, or perhaps she's just a lawfully abiding citizen taking rest from her journey...

options.label: A
options.narrative: Tie her hands together while she sleeps.

outcomes.narrative: You begin to slowly tie rope around her hands when her snoring comes to an abrupt halt. "What are you doing?!" she exclaims. As you explain you're there to collect her bounty and won't leave without a fight, she retrieves identification and proves you mistaken. She curses you for disturbing her slumber and rolls back into the straw.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Awaken and interrogate the figure.

outcomes.narrative: You shake the girl awake and demand identification. She angrily shows you her identification, proven you mistaken. After a bit of conversation, you find out she's been separated from her group and you invite her to join you on your journey.
effects: Spawn one normal Bandit Archer next to any character. It is an ally to you and an enemy to all monsters. It has a maximum hit point value of 3, regardless of the value listed on its stat sheet.

narrative: About halfway through your journey, you happen upon a merchant's caravan set up on the side of the road. There is a small shop sign which piques your curiosity, and you enter the caravan. You're taken aback when you find an old friend, the Chainguard, who greets you as you enter.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Choose the rusty spikes trap.

outcomes.narrative: The rusty spikes trap! Great choice, use it wisely," the Chainguard hands you the trap and bids you farewell.
effects: At the start of the scenario, place one 4 damage WOUND trap in an empty hex adjacent to any enemy.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Choose the clamping snare trap.

outcomes.narrative: The clamping snare. Great for stopping anything right in its tracks!" the Chainguard hands you the trap and wishes you the best of luck on your journey.
effects: At the start of the scenario, place one STUN trap in an empty hex adjacent to any enemy.

narrative: It's dark at night and you're traveling near the shorelines when your lamp unexpectedly burns out. Realizing you have not brought enough oil to rekindle the light, you cautiously continue on with your journey when you notice a glowing light source up ahead. As you near the light source, you find yourself face-to-face with a giant glowing lurker. You carefully approach the creature and see a sign posted nearby that reads, 'LUMINARY FOR HIRE: 10 GOLD.'

options.label: A
options.narrative: Pay the lurker to escort you on your journey.

outcomes.narrative: The lurker happily accepts your sum and accompanies you on your journey, lighting the path ahead. When you reach your destination, it doesn't want to leave your side. It seems it's here to stay, and you realize you haven't just hired a light source... you hired a mercenary.
effects: Spawn one normal Lurker next to any character. It is an ally to you and an enemy to all monsters. It has a maximum hit point value of 4, regardless of the value listed on its stat sheet.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Save your hard-earned coin and take your chances in the dark.

outcomes.narrative: You continue on with your journey, making your way off the shoreline and into a forest when you accidentally stumble into a thornbush. Bruised and cut, you finally reach your destination and vow never to travel without extra oil again.

narrative: You're walking along a shoreline when you take notice of glowing lights emanating from beneath the sand. You dig into the sand and pull out several detached lurker claws, each glowing a different color. On one side of your feet you see one claw radiating a soft blue glow, while another looks and feels like a hot coal. On the other side of your feet you find a claw radiating a strong yellow, and it's sitting aside a darkened claw with a dim black glimmer. You have a feeling the glowing lights will help you on your journey, but only have room for two.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Take the soft blue and glowing red claws.

outcomes.narrative: You take the soft blue and glowing red claws and continue on with your journey. As you reach your destination, each claw emits one last burst of light before their glow fades away.
effects: Start scenario with ICE and FIRE in the Strong column.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Take the bright yellow and dim black claws.

outcomes.narrative: You take the bright yellow and dim black claws and continue on with your journey. As you reach your destination, each claw emits one last burst of light before their glow fades away.
effects: Start scenario with LIGHT and DARK in the Strong column.

narrative: "Thank you! Thank you!" the Vermling falls to your feet and begins kissing your toes. You've helped pull his carriage out of a deep pile of mud, and the green-robed Vermling couldn't be more grateful. "Alas!" he exclaims. "A gift, for your troubles." The Vermling rushes into the carriage and pulls out two glowing rods. "Please, take one. It will help you rest on your journey."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Take the shorter rod on the left.

outcomes.narrative: "Ah! The shorter rod will serve you well if you ever decide to quickly rest," the Vermling glees as he hands you the shorter rod.
effects: Whenever a character takes a short rest during the scenario, they may perform "Heal 1, Self".

options.label: B
options.narrative: Take the longer rod on the right.

outcomes.narrative: "The longer rod, very well! This rod will ensure that you get the most fulfillment out of your resting," the Vermling smiles while gracefully handing you the longer rod.
effects: Whenever a character takes a long rest during the scenario, they may recover 3 hit points instead of 2 hit points.

narrative: Traveling through a dense forest at night, you see a faint green light emanating from a bush off the path. There is a faint whining emanating from the small shrub, and as you turn to walk away, the light intensifies and you hear a whispering voice from behind the bush. "Here here, traveler." Interested by the prospect of what may be beckoning you, you approach the bush and see a Vermling hunched behind, waving her hands around. "There is great spiritual energy here," she explains. "I can feel it. I can impart this upon you, but I warn you - the energy works differently with everyone. Should I restrain the energy and leave you with all but a taste, or are you ready to experience its full potential?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Ask her to restrain the energy; you're not quite sure what you can handle.

outcomes.narrative: You ask the Vermling to restrain the energy and she nods and begins to chant. The light suddenly escapes from the bush and wraps around your body before slowly dimming. It's as if your body absorbed the light, and you begin to feel a strange sensation.
effects: One character starts scenario with MUDDLE.
All other characters start with STRENGTHEN.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Tell her to hold nothing back. You're ready for anything.

outcomes.narrative: You ask the Vermling to hold nothing back and she begins to shriek and wave her hands frantically in the air. The light intensifies until it becomes blinding and you shudder as you close your eyes. All of a sudden, her shrieking stops and you open your eyes to find nothing but a singed twig in the place of the bush, and a burning sensation running through you like nothing you've ever experienced before.
effects: One character starts scenario with STUN.
All other characters start with INVISIBLE.

narrative: It's a particularly starry night and you happen upon an Aesther looking up into the stars. He ushers you toward him and points up in the sky. "See those constellations? I can read them for you. Tell me, what do you see in the stars?" You look up to the sky and see a multitude of stars. It's hard to make out a shape, but it looks like there might be stars connecting in the letter 'T' or 'V,' but you're unsure which.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Tell the Aesther you see a large 'T' shape in the sky.

outcomes.narrative: You tell the Aesther you see the letter 'T' formed in the stars. He shakes his head and tells you, "tsk, that's the constellation of terror. I see your enemies will be moving forward, even as we speak. Best hurry on, dear travelers, before they advance too quickly."
effects: At start of scenario, before the first round, all monsters perform "Move 1".

options.label: B
options.narrative: Tell the Aesther you see a large 'V' shape in the sky.

outcomes.narrative: You tell the Aesther you see the letter 'V' formed in the stars. He nods his head in affirmation and tells you, "that's the constellation of victory. You will have an advantage in the battlefield and move as quickly as a shooting star! I bid you well, dear travelers, and success in your journey."
effects: At start of scenario, before the first round, all characters may perform a "Move 2" ability.

narrative: Walking along a brook late at night, you come across a familiar Aesther gazing up into the stars. You recognize the Aesther as the Starslinger, and it greets you with a warm smile.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Tell the Aesther you're in pursuit of health.

outcomes.narrative: You tell the Aesther you're in pursuit of health and it points to the stars. "I'll be sure to wish upon a certain star for you tonight, and should the constellations align you will find yourself in full health!"
effects: All start scenario by overhealing 2 hit points.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Tell the Aesther you're in pursuit of wealth.

outcomes.narrative: You tell the Aesther you're in pursuit of wealth and it points to the stars. "I'll be sure to wish upon a certain star for you tonight, and should the constellations align you will find yourself with great fortune!"
effects: The first player to loot a treasure tile this scenario gains an additional 10 GOLD.

narrative: On the road to your next adventure, you spot a trade caravan with a broken wheel off to the side of the path. As you approach, you notice multiple human bodies lying motionless on the ground near the wagon as an Inox and Savvas are rummaging through the chests that fell from the wagon. At first, you suspect that you are witnessing a robbery in progress, but after further inspection, you realize they are placing the chests back onto the wagon, taking particular care with an especially ornate chest. You keep your distance for now, but can overhear the pair conversing. "Those bandits came out of nowhere," the Savvas says to his companion. "Yeah," the Inox replies in between heavy breaths. "Keep watch. Could be more on the way." They take a moment to catch their breath before getting back to work. "I'll grab some tools and try to repair the wheel," the Savvas states matter-of-factly.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Help the traders get their wagon back on the road.

outcomes.narrative: While the Savvas wrenches on the wagon, your strength makes short work of reloading the fallen chests. The Inox standing guard gruffs, "Thanks for helping. Take this schematic as our thanks."
You offer to stand guard while the traders fix their wagon. Unfortunately, this takes much longer than anticipated, but at least they pay your wage as promised before leaving.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Create a distraction and attempt to steal the ornate chest.

outcomes.narrative: Your allies provide an effective distraction and you are able to sneak away unnoticed with the ornate chest in hand.
Distracting the guards is easy enough, but escaping unscathed is another matter entirely. Fortunately, your ally was quick enough to avoid capture, but you are disappointed to leave empty-handed.

narrative: You barely make it outside the city gates before spotting a thick column of smoke spreading across the horizon ahead. You can tell from the militaristic shouts behind you that the Fire Brigade was quick to summon their ranks today. The Brigade soon comes trudging past at a quickened pace, eager to protect the city and its outlying cottages from this growing wildfire. You spot your former companion, the Fire Knight, among their ranks, who breaks formation to speak with you. "Hey old friends. Want to earn some gold?!" he asks excitedly. "The Brigade will pay anyone willing to help extinguish spot fires during these big incidents. Sure, it's dangerous, but nothing you can't handle." The Fire Knight smirks, bouncing a ball of flame between his hands. "Or, another way you can help is by clearing out brush from around the cottages on the outskirts of the city. If you know the forest, that should be a breeze for you."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Help extinguish spot fires near the fire front.

outcomes.narrative: You are excited to work alongside your old friend again, but extinguishing spot fires is no easy task, especially in a forest filled with wild creatures frightened by the destruction of their homes. The Fire Knight gives you a few pointers as to the best techniques to extinguish hot spots before rejoining the Brigade on the front lines of the firefight. Hopefully your combined efforts will control this spreading wildfire before it burns the forest down.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Help clear out brush from around the outlying cottages.

outcomes.narrative: Your familiarity with the forest paths and shrubbery makes clearing out the brush a simple task that your party accomplishes safely before returning to its quest.

Clearing out the brush may not require much skill, but your lack of familiarity with the forest greens results in a failure to properly handle the poisonous shrubbery surrounding the outlying cottages.

narrative: You set out from the city far later than you had intended and the stormy weather that hasn't subsided all day isn't making the journey any easier. In fact, the path you'd planned on taking is flooded and wading through the mud would leave you vulnerable to whatever wild animals are lurking in the dark. There is a clearer path you could take, but that would add an extra few hours and you're already just to so worn.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Stick to the plan and push through the mud.

outcomes.narrative: Your familiarity with the wilderness helps guide your party through the mud without exposing yourselves to an attack.

It starts off well, but it isn't long before you find yourselves waist deep in mud and surrounded by wolves. You are able to fight them off, but not unscathed. You can't help but think that fighting off wolves is probably more exhausting than taking the long way around.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Take the long way around. It's not worth the risk.

outcomes.narrative: You're not happy about the situation, but being attacked while knee-deep in mud is exactly the luck you've been having today, so you decide not to risk it. The rest of the trip is uneventful, but exhausting.

narrative: The road has been rather uneventful today and the weather has been kind to you. There are some merchants transporting goods following the same path you take, only a few minutes behind you, but they are minding their own business. In fact, you are thinking to yourself that the situation feels almost too calm when you spot a narrow path carved through the bush to the side of the road.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Don't tempt fate. Continue along the uneventful road enjoying the day.

outcomes.narrative: You knew it was too good to be true. No more than 20 minutes pass before you are ambushed by thieves. It is likely the thieves were waiting for the merchants behind you, and you were just in the wrong place at the wrong time.

options.label: B
options.narrative: What's an adventure without taking any chances? Explore the path in the brush.

outcomes.narrative: It takes no more than 20 minutes before you realize that this path is a little too tight and overgrown for you to go any further. However, a familiar voice calls to you, "Friends, what in the world are you doing here?" the Mirefoot exclaims. It turns out he's found the trail to a Ghost Viper nest and gives you directions to it. After parting ways and returning to the main road, your good fortune continues. Not far up the road you discover a ransacked caravan with some goods left over that you can easily sell.

narrative: As you travel along the path, you hear strange noises from just out of sight ahead, away from the road. As you approach, a blinding bolt of lightning fills the sky followed shortly by ear-splitting thunder. Undeterred, you press forward. As you continue, the sounds of battle end abruptly. You reach the site of the struggle and find two corpses. The first is a battered Savvas whose rocky skin has been partially dissolved into coarse black sand around the edges of several vicious-looking sword cuts. The second corpse is a charred and frozen Aesther whose shadowy ashlades lay fallen at the ground by its sides alongside an ominously glowing amethyst.

options.label: A
options.narrative: Loot the bodies. They don't need it, we're not picky, and that gem looks valuable.

outcomes.narrative: As you touch the glowing stones and ashen blades, you feel a corrupt energy course through your body. You immediately drop the items, realizing in horror that these items must have been tainted by the Void. Those of you who are not fortified against the Void feel their life essence drained by the contact. You abandon these accursed items with all haste.

As you touch the glowing stones and ashen blades, you feel a corrupt energy course through your body. You immediately drop the items, realizing in horror that these items must have been tainted by the Void. Those of you who are not fortified against the Void feel their life essence drained by the contact. You abandon these accursed items with all haste.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Leave the area. Who knows what lingering effect the powers used may have had.

outcomes.narrative: Seeing the coarse black sand disfiguring the wounds of the Savvas reminds you of seeing similar damage among victims of the Void in Gloomhaven. That black sand is a telltale sign of corruption and danger. You think better of looting something so suspicious. Carefully, without touching the bodies or equipment, you take time to hide the site. Perhaps someday you can return and safely cleanse or destroy these items, but for now, it's better if no one stumbles across them.

narrative:
As you round a turn in the road, you're surprised to see two Savvas locked in combat, circling each other.

One of them you recognize as your former Hollowpact companion. The other figure appears to be a younger but similarly accoutred Savvas. Both have glowing amethyst stones filling their chest cavities with an otherworldly light.

The two Hollowpacts are undeterred by your presence and continue to circle each other, searching for an opening. Both are lithe and move with a duelist's grace despite their rocky forms—a notable difference in style from many of their Savvas kin. Your former companion turns slightly and addresses you, "This one is mine. Stay out of this. Won't ask twice."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Try to calm the situation. There's no need for this violence.

outcomes.narrative:
The younger Hollowpact takes advantage of your interruption to teleport away. Your former ally ignores this and turns to you, its voice grating like jagged rocks against metal, "You. DON'T understand. We are abominations. Must die. Must ALL die."

A moment passes and rage is instantly replaced by calm. The Hollowpact speaks again with a ponderous, gravelly voice, "I can track and destroy my quarry easily enough. I save this young one from itself. Stop me again and die." With that, the Hollowpact vanishes.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Listen to your former ally. Watch the events unfold without interference.

outcomes.narrative: Once it becomes clear you won't intervene, the two Hollowpact return their focus to each other. The younger Hollowpact strikes first, lashing out with a devastating flurry. The elder Savvas dodges several blows and then, in between incoming strikes, grabs the glowing stone in the chest of the younger fighter and shatters it in a burst of energy. The younger Hollowpact's eyes grow wide as it begins to disintegrate from the inside out. Your former ally nods, kicks the slain Savvas's coin purse to you, and vanishes.

narrative: You're drawn toward colorful pillars of smoke pouring out from a small cavern on the side of the road. Curiosity gets the better of you as you wade through the smoke and enter the cavern, only to see a familiar figure standing near a stone covered in chromatic ooze. It's the Brightspark, and he's clapping in delight as he reaches for a vial on the stone beside him. "My friends!" he calls toward you with glee. "I've found a secluded place to conduct my experiments, and I must tell you, the elemental converter is coming along quite nicely." "Anyways, you must try one of these new potions! I've got a few options, so take your pick!"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Reach for the multi-hued colorful vial of ooze.

outcomes.narrative: "Amazing!" the Brightspark hands you the colorful vial and points toward your mouth. You uncap the vial and quickly drink it. It tickles your throat as the Brightspark suddenly turns red. "You were supposed to rub it on your lips, not drink it!" No wonder your throat won't stop itching. "Well," the Brightspark clears his throat, "Let's just hope you find plenty of bathroom stops along the way!"

options.label: B
options.narrative: Reach for the dull gray vial of ooze.

outcomes.narrative: "Here you go, handle it with care!" the Brightspark carefully hands you the dull gray vial of ooze. "Shake it and then uncap it when you're ready for a bedazzling chemical reaction!"
effects: At the start of the scenario, start with any two elements in the Strong column.

narrative: Just outside the city gates, you hear a cacophonous roar emanate from the other side of a hill and decide to investigate. As you draw near, you recognize familiar sounds — Inox grunting, Harrowers chittering, Vermlings screeching. But something is different. Are they... cheering? You crest the hill to discover a throng of bodies from every race milling about a variety of booths hosting various competitions. "Welcome to the Gloomhaven Games!" a Quatryl gamemaster yells into an amplifying device. "All are invited to enjoy the festivities!" One booth surrounded by Valraths hollering with excitement grabs your attention. You are not surprised to see the Fire Knight emerge from the crowd with a foolish grin on his face. "Hey, old friends! The Fire Brigade hosts a competition for the chance to win discounted gear. You should be familiar with the challenge from your visit to the station. Let's see if you remember your training!"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Enter the strength contest.

outcomes.narrative: You may choose to redraw one of your cards.
effects: You may buy any one item (63-72) at the discount below based on the number of positive attack modifier cards drawn.

outcomes.narrative: No effect.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Enter the intelligence contest.

outcomes.narrative: You may choose to redraw one of the cards.
effects: All may buy any one item (73-82) at the discount below based on the number of attack modifier cards that match the color of the first card drawn.
Discount - number of matches x 6 gold

outcomes.narrative: No effect.

narrative:
"Red berries, green berries, get your berries here!" you hear a melodious choir chanting from a caravan slowly passing you by. A Vermling pokes it head out of the caravan, and it comes to a screeching halt. "Traveler! Have you ever seen or tasted such a spectacular delicacy?" the Vermling extends both hands to reveal a handful of sticky berries, juice dripping from his paws.

You shake your head in disgust, remembering your promise to never eat roadside berries again, when the Vermling shakes his head and grabs your shoulder. "These are no ordinary berries. They're infused with the psychic power which will allow you manifest your greatest inner potential. Therefore, I insist! Take your pick, red or green?"

options.label: A
options.narrative: Choose the red berries.

outcomes.narrative: You choose to eat the red berries, and although the taste is familiar, you begin to sense the power described by the Vermling.
effects: IF "NATURALIST" OR "TRAILBLAZERS": At the end of the first round, all characters may Recover one lost card.
IF "EXPLORERS," "MILITANTS" OR "PROTECTORS": All characters start the scenario by overhealing by 3 hit points, but their maximum hit point value remains the same.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Choose the green berries.

outcomes.narrative: You choose to eat the green berries, and although the taste is familiar, you begin to sense the power described by the Vermling.
effects: IF "TRAILBLAZERS" OR "EXPLORERS": During the first round, all Move abilities by characters have their value doubled.
IF "MILITANTS," "PROTECTORS" OR "NATURALISTS": At the end of the first round, all characters may Refresh one spent or consumed item.

narrative: As the moonlight shines bright upon the field before you, you contemplate setting up your tent here for the evening when you suddenly hear a rustling from within the tall grass before you. An Inox jumps out from the grass, and as you reach for your weapon she puts out her hand, as if to express caution. "Fear not, I mean you no harm," the Inox tells you. "I'm here looking for a cave nearby, which is rumored to host the corpses of wealthy merchants, riddled with abandoned jewelry." "However," the Inox continues, "I fear for bandits. Would you care to escort me on this journey? I'd be willing to split the loot with you."

options.label: A
options.narrative: Join her to search for the cave together.

outcomes.narrative: You accept the Inox' offer, and your savviness of the wilderness helps her navigate through terrain which leads you both to a small cave. The cave turns out to be empty, but there is an inscription on the wall which peaks your curiosity.

As you make your way through the tall grass, the Inox seems to struggle to keep up through the terrain and you're unsure how to help. She grows tired and gives up, wishing you luck as she disappears into the night.

options.label: B
options.narrative: Decline her offer and seek the cave on your own.

outcomes.narrative: You decide to find the cave on your own, and after hours of searching, you come across a small cave. Although there are no corpses to be found, there is an inscription on the wall which peaks your interest.

You spend hours searching but find yourself cursing your navigation skills as the sun begins to rise. With daylight approaching, it's time to move on and continue with your journey, as there's no more time to rest.
effects: All suffer 1 damage and start scenario with MUDDLE.
